knimeNode.name: Row Sampling
knimeNode.shortDescription: Extracts a sample (a bunch of rows) from the input data.

fullDescription.intro: This node extracts a sample (a bunch of rows) from the input data. The dialog enables you to specify the sample size. The following options are available in the dialog:
fullDescription.option: Specify the absolute number of rows in the sample. If there are less rows than specified here, all rows are used.
The percentage of the number of rows in the sample. Must be between 0 and 100, inclusively.

Random sampling. Check the "Seed" button and add a random seed to have deterministic sampling, i.e. each execution results in the same sampling. If you do not specify a random seed, the sampling will differ when the node is re-executed.
This mode selects the top most rows of the table.

Check this button if you want stratified sampling, i.e. the distribution of values in the selected column is (approximately) retained in the output table. Stratified sampling only works when random sampling is enabled.

This mode always includes the first and the last row and selects the remaining rows linearly over the whole table (e.g. every third row). This is useful to downsample a sorted column while maintaining minimum and maximum value.
